main event: An unconventional cigar-shaped object was sighted over Lake Champlain, Vermont on December 13, 1950 at 2100 hours.
interesting points: Witnesses reported the object was orange-red in color., The object was estimated to be 4-5 yards long., It executed a very sharp 'L' pattern while maneuvering., The object was reported to be faster than any conventional aircraft., Multiple eyewitnesses included civilians such as a mill hand, store clerk, student, and housewife.
witness description: civilians including a mill hand, store clerk, student, and housewife
